intro: Seseli tortuosum var. graecum, commonly known as Greek seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
